intro: Tephrosia curtissii, commonly known as the Florida tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, preferring moist, acidic soils. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Tephrosia curtissii is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
